author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Farmers Block Roads, Maduro’s Trial, and Mass Wedding in India

author: Epoch Video
description: The U.S. Congress Intelligence Committee leader and party leaders (Gang of Eight) speak after a briefing on Venezuela on the afternoon of Jan. 5.
title: LIVE NOW: Congress Intelligence Committee Leader and Party Leaders Speak After Briefing on Venezuela

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Over the past three decades, parents and voters in Canada have seen their influence over education decline as school boards have grown larger and decision-making has become more centralized, a new study says. Published on Jan. 5 by the think tank Aristotle Foundation, the study examines the steady decline in the number of local school […]
title: Parents, Voters Have Less Say in Education as School Boards Expand in Canada, Study Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Premier Doug Ford says he is “100 percent” committed to removing Crown Royal whiskey from all Ontario-run liquor stores next month when manufacturer Diageo closes its bottling plant in the southwestern part of the province. Ford has been critical of Diageo since the British alcoholic beverage company announced plans in late August to shutter its […]
title: Ford Confirms Plan to Ban Crown Royal From LCBO in February

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The French president and his wife are taking separate legal action against American conservative influencer Candace Owens for amplifying the rumors.
title: 10 Found Guilty of Cyberbullying Brigitte Macron Over Claims She Was Born Male

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Ukraine is reshaping its defense and intelligence leadership and operations as U.S.-backed peace efforts and pressure from Russia continue.
title: Ukraine’s Top Security Official Resigns Amid Zelenskyy’s Wartime Defense Shakeup

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says his government is supporting a Venezuela-led transition of power in the aftermath of the U.S. capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, with Washington saying it will lead the transition. Carney spoke with former Venezuelan Opposition leader María Corina Machado in a Jan. 4 call, the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) said […]
title: Carney Tells Venezuelan Opposition Figure Canada Supports ‘Negotiated’ Leadership Transition

author: Lily Zhou
description: The city's anti-corruption campaign on building renovation came after unsafe materials were found in a residential fire that killed at least 161.
title: Hong Kong Arrests 21 in Renovation Graft Crackdown

author: Frank Fang
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan—The Chinese regime’s cyber army launched a daily average of 2.63 million cyberattacks on Taiwan’s critical infrastructure in 2025, marking a 6 percent year-over-year increase, according to a report released by Taiwan’s National Security Bureau (NSB) on Jan. 5. “Such a trend indicates a deliberate attempt by China to compromise Taiwan’s CI [critical infrastructure] […]
title: China Hit Taiwan With 2.63 Million Cyberattacks Daily in 2025, Report Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada’s national food inspector has suspended the safe food licence of Montreal-based meal kit delivery company Goodfood.  There is no recall linked to the suspension of the Safe Food for Canadians licence, but the company will be unable to manufacture, process, preserve, or package food for delivery during the suspension, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency […]
title: CFIA Suspends Safe Food Licence for Meal Kit Delivery Service Goodfood

author: PA Media
description: A farmer who was diagnosed with bowel cancer aged 33 has urged other young people to get symptoms of the disease checked out. James Rogers, from Berkhamsted in Hertfordshire, who runs a large Christmas tree farm, was diagnosed with bowel cancer last May. He needed urgent surgery to remove a tumour and then underwent chemotherapy. […]
title: Farmer Diagnosed With Bowel Cancer Aged 33 Urges Others to Get Symptoms Checked

author: PA Media
description: A man has been fined £500 after he admitted dressing as an admiral without permission at a Remembrance Sunday event. Jonathan Carley, 65, from Harlech, Gwynedd, appeared at Llandudno Magistrates’ Court on Monday charged with wearing uniform or dress bearing the mark of His Majesty’s Forces without permission. The court heard Carley wore the uniform […]
title: Man Fined After He Admits Dressing as Admiral Without Permission

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer insisted Britain will turn a corner in 2026, as he made his first visit of the year to meet members of the public. Speaking at a community centre in Reading, the Prime Minister made reference to the US operation in Venezuela over the weekend, but acknowledged people had other day-to-day priorities. He […]
title: Britain Will Turn a Corner in 2026, Vows Starmer

author: Jack Phillips
description: Venezuelan applicants can apply for refugee status if they have not entered the United States, the agency says.
title: Deportation Flights of Venezuelans Not Paused After Maduro Arrest, DHS Confirms

author: PA Media
description: A spring statement will be delivered in Parliament on Tuesday March 3, Rachel Reeves has told MPs. The statement will follow an economic and fiscal forecast by the Office for Budget Responsibility (OBR), due to be prepared for that date, the Chancellor said in a written statement to the Commons. Ms Reeves insisted the Government […]
title: Spring Statement to Take Place on March 3, Rachel Reeves Tells MPs

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec students returning to class after winter break will now have to use formal language to address their teachers under new rules designed to foster civility. The province announced last year that public and private schools had until January to create a code of conduct that includes requirements for students to address teachers and staff […]
title: Quebec Students Must Address Teachers as ‘Mr.’ and ‘Ms.’ Under New Civility Rules

author: Eva Fu
description: Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi said he's proud of what the bipartisan committee has accomplished.
title: Top Democrat on China Select Committee to Step Down

author: Dorothy Li
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung made his first state visit to China since taking office last year.
title: South Korea’s Lee Urges Regional Peace in Summit With China’s Xi

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The EU's statement was supported by 26 of the bloc's 27 member states, with Hungary the only country not to endorse it.
title: Respecting Will of Venezuelans Only Way to Restore Democracy, EU Says

author: Noé Chartier
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he has appointed Canadian MP and former deputy prime minister Chrystia Freeland as an adviser on economic development. “Chrystia is highly skilled in these matters and has extensive experience in attracting investment and implementing economic transformations,” Zelenskyy said in an X post announcing the appointment on Jan. 5. Freeland served […]
title: Chrystia Freeland Named as Ukraine Economic Adviser: President Zelenskyy

author: Jack Phillips
description: Nicolás Maduro's deputy, now the country's interim leader, said, 'We invite the U.S. government to collaborate with us.'
title: Venezuela’s Acting President Says She Wants to Cooperate With US

author: Epoch Video
description: Venezuela’s legislature convenes at 10 a.m. ET on Jan. 5 for a new five-year term in the wake of the U.S. capture of Nicolás Maduro.
title: LIVE NOW: Venezuela Legislature Convenes for New 5-Year Term Following Capture of Maduro

author: Jack Phillips
description: The president delivered a stark message to Mexico, Cuba, and Colombia.
title: Trump Issues Warning to Mexico, Other Latin American Countries Following Venezuela Strike

author: PA Media
description: Hundreds of schools have been shut and flights cancelled as weather warnings remain in force with snow bringing disruption. Amber weather warnings were in place for snow until 10am in parts of Scotland, forecasting “heavy snow” and travel disruption, while yellow warnings for snow and ice still cover parts of the UK. A number of […]
title: Schools closed and flights cancelled as warnings for snow and ice in force

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Si Ji Mei brand Wuhan Egg Sheets with Glutinous Rice is being recalled in B.C. and Alberta due to potential salmonella contamination after reports of consumers falling ill. A recall notice issued by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) identifies the affected product as Si Ji Mei’s Wuhan Egg Sheets with Glutinous Rice, 580 grams, […]
title: Salmonella Concerns Prompt Egg Sheet Recall in Two Provinces as Illnesses Reported

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A Hamilton man is facing several charges after the Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) received multiple reports of a truck operating on just three wheels along a major southern Ontario highway on New Year’s Eve. Burlington OPP began to receive reports at approximately 11:20 p.m. after multiple motorists spotted a badly damaged pickup truck driving along […]
title: Police Pull Over Truck Missing Tire, Charge Hamilton Man With Impaired Driving

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Rights groups say at least 16 people have been killed as unrest triggered by economic woes has widened and Trump is signaling a readiness to act.
title: Trump Escalates Warning to Iran as Protest Death Toll Mounts

author: Troy Myers
description: At a local Venezuelan restaurant in Doral, Florida, hundreds of expatriates gathered to celebrate the U.S. capture of Maduro.
title: America’s Largest Venezuelan Community Praises US Military’s Capture of Maduro

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The alleged attack happened during ongoing negotiations between Moscow and Kyiv to end the conflict, which is heading into its fourth year next month.
title: Trump Says Ukraine Did Not Target Putin’s Residence, Countering Kremlin Claims

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham said buying cheap Russian oil keeps Russian President Vladimir Putin's war machine going.
title: Trump Says US Could Increase Tariffs on India Due to Russian Oil Imports

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: Cuba’s government said the officers were members of the Cuban armed forces and the Interior Ministry.
title: Cuba Says 32 Cuban Officers Killed in US Military Operation in Venezuela

author: Joseph Lord
description: The captured Venezuelan leader is set to be arraigned at noon on Monday in a Manhattan federal court before Judge Alvin Hellerstein.
title: Maduro to Be Arraigned in Federal Court on Narco-Terrorism Charges

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: In Australia's capital cities, hundreds gathered to celebrate Nicolas Maduro's removal, and to also protest it.
title: ‘All Kinds of Opinions, But We Are Happy’: Venezuelans Reflect on End of Maduro’s Rule

author: Jerry Zhu
description: The new changes ease the eligibility to receive 3 days of guaranteed childcare per week.
title: Treasurer Says 100,000 Families to Benefit as 3-Day Childcare Guarantee Kicks In

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: In two separate incidents, hackers have broken into the database of a healthcare portal and a large media-run community site and demanded a ransom.
title: Major Data Breaches Put Hundreds of Thousands of New Zealanders At Risk

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: Colombia, Mexico, and Cuba have strongly denounced U.S. airstrikes on Venezuela.
title: Trump Hints at Possible Military Operations in Colombia, Mexico, Expects Cuba’s Downfall

author: AAP
description: Sam Groth said too much pressure on his family was the main reason for the former tennis pro’s exit from politics.
title: ‘Extremely Challenging’: Liberal Star to Quit Politics

author: The Associated Press
description: YOBE, Nigeria—A passenger boat capsized in northern Nigeria’s Yobe state, leaving at least 25 people dead while 14 others remained missing, emergency services said Sunday. The boat was carrying residents who had gone to the local market as well as some who were involved in fishing or farming when it capsized along the Yobe River […]
title: Boat Capsizes in Nigeria’s Yobe State, Leaving 25 Dead and 14 Missing

author: The Associated Press
description: BERLIN—Many households and businesses in south-west Berlin face days without electricity after high-voltage power lines were damaged by a fire which city authorities said Sunday was a result of a politically motivated attack by “left-wing extremists.” The fire broke out on Saturday morning on a cable bridge over the Teltow Canal, near the Lichterfelde power […]
title: Berlin Power Outage Affecting 45,000 Homes Blamed on ‘Politically Motivated’ Attack

author: Reuters
description: SEOUL—North Korea test-fired hypersonic missiles on Sunday, state media KCNA reported on Monday, to ‍assess its military operational capability regarding war ‍deterrence. North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, who oversaw the missile launch, said: “It’s a very important strategy to maintain ‌or expand the strong and reliable nuclear deterrent,” because of “the recent geopolitical ⁠crisis […]
title: North Korea Test-Fires Hypersonic Missiles, KCNA Says

author: Reuters
description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria—At least 30 people were killed and several others abducted when gunmen attacked a market in Nigeria’s Niger State, police ‍said on Sunday. Police spokesperson Wasiu Abiodun said the ‍gunmen, locally called bandits, stormed Kasuwan Daji market in Demo village, at around 4:30 p.m. on Saturday burning stalls and looting food ‌items. “Over 30 […]
title: At Least 30 Killed in Nigeria Market Attack, Police Say

author: Reuters
description: ZURICH—All 40 people who died in the New Year’s Eve bar fire in Switzerland have been identified, police said on Sunday, with teenagers making up more than half of the death toll. The final 16 victims have now been identified, Valais Police said, following the blaze at the mountain resort of Crans-Montana early on Jan. […]
title: All the Victims of Swiss Bar Fire Now Identified, Swiss Police Say

author: Reuters
description: ATHENS—Flights across Greece were grounded for several hours on Sunday after a collapse of radio frequencies crippled air traffic communications, stranding thousands of travellers and bringing airport operations to a virtual standstill. Authorities said the disruption began at 8:59 a.m. local time (0659 GMT), when most aviation radio frequencies were hit by massive interference, forcing […]
title: Some Greek Flights Resume After Air Traffic Radio Collapse

author: Autumn Spredemann
description: Some say the removal of the contested Venezuelan leader is only the beginning.
title: Venezuela After Maduro: Celebration and Challenges Ahead
